meanings.definition: A heavy, silver-white metallic element that is liquid at room temperature.
meanings.sent1: The thermometer contained mercury to measure the temperature.
meanings.sent2: The mercury spilled from the broken thermometer.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted the mercury-filled thermometer off the table.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were as quicksilver as mercury, always changing.
meanings.sent5: The mercury shimmered like liquid silver in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The planet closest to the sun in our solar system.
meanings.sent1: Mercury orbits the sun faster than any other planet.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study Mercury to learn more about our solar system.
meanings.sent3: The aliens visited Earth to see the famous Mercury up close.
meanings.sent4: His mind raced like Mercury, always moving from one idea to the next.
meanings.sent5: The brightness of Mercury in the night sky captivated the stargazers.

meanings.definition: A type of thermometer containing mercury as the measuring fluid.
meanings.sent1: The old mercury thermometer showed the room was too hot.
meanings.sent2: The nurse used a mercury thermometer to check the patient's temperature.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy scientist accidentally dropped the mercury thermometer.
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed smoothly, like mercury in a thermometer.
meanings.sent5: The mercury thermometer glinted in the light, ready to give its reading.
